derivation: from G3956 (παῤῥησία) and a derivative of G4483 (παῤῥησία);
kjv_def: bold (X -ly, -ness, -ness of speech), confidence, X freely, X openly, X plainly(-ness)
strongs_def: all out-spokenness, i.e. frankness, bluntness, publicity; by implication, assurance
outline:
1. freedom in speaking, unreservedness in speech
    1. openly, frankly, i.e without concealment
    2. without ambiguity or circumlocution
    3. without the use of figures and comparisons
  2. free and fearless confidence, cheerful courage, boldness, assurance
  3. the deportment by which one becomes conspicuous or secures publicity
